intro: Sticherus loheri var. loheri, commonly known as the Loher's sticherus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
